subject: Personal Finance
title: Saving vs Investing the Buffer
description: A micro-lesson that makes Saving vs Investing the Buffer usable.

hook.text: Your emergency fund earns 0.5% in savings. The stock market returns 10%. Why not invest it?

buildup.text: Investing the emergency fund means selling stocks during a crisis â€” often at the worst time.

discovery.text: Emergencies and market crashes often happen together. You'd sell low exactly when you need cash most.

twist.text: The low return on the emergency fund isn't waste. It's the price of instant, reliable access.

climax.text: High-yield savings accounts offer a middle ground â€” better returns with no market risk.

punchline.text: The emergency fund's job is access, not growth.

quiz.question: Why shouldn't emergency funds be invested in stocks?
options: Emergencies and market crashes often coincide
